body:
Comment 999 by **ldlandis**: 
Recognizing the long standing tradition of this group (Thompson, Pike, et al), the
name of this language should be P or gooP* (single case please, the former was for
emphasis, see note) or similar.

Reason: BCPL was the basis for the B language, which then was refined to the C
language.  Clearly (for over 30 years now), P is the next (penultimate) language.
Once this group moves on to the next language (10-20 years), the (ultimate) language
should be called L thus completing the sequence.

Also, You guys deserve better than "go" no matter how you spell it.

* Dennis and Ken have long lamented (that I've heard) calling UNIX "UNIX" (all caps)
instead of Unix or unix.  I like "civilized" spelling rather than shouting.  I say
make the language name a noun (e.g. unix/goop), and only capitalize it at the
beginning of sentences (e.g. Unix/Goop, if there is competition for P/p).

Cheers,
  --ldl@linux.com
